1468359849843036170.text: The women who bravely serve our country shouldn't be expected to pay a “pink tax” on their military uniforms. That's why I'm glad to see my bipartisan bill with @SenJoniErnst to address this inequity included in this year's defense bill.

1468349849192083457.text: UPDATE: My bipartisan amendment with @JohnCornyn is set to be included in this year’s defense bill. It will allow the National Guard to better help state and local governments and private companies improve their cybersecurity.

1468340102644576263.text: This year’s defense bill will help ensure that the U.S. continues to be ready to lead, and I was proud to see today that key provisions I’ve pushed for—including to strengthen cybersecurity—are included. I’ll continue to work with my colleagues to get this bill signed into law.

1425592975187402762.text:

Our bipartisan package also recognizes the urgent need to address climate change, investing $73 billion in clean energy transmission and battery energy storage development.
 
This builds on my bipartisan Battery Storage Innovation Act, which became law last December. [4/6]

1425592971995529222.text:
This package also acknowledges how critical it is for everyone to have access to high-speed internet in today's economy and includes $65 billion in funding to do that.
 
This will allow states to expand broadband access and help families afford high-speed internet at home. [3/6]

1425592970548588548.text:
To start, this package makes a record-level investment in restoring our country’s roads, bridges, and highways — to the tune of $110 billion.
 
This funding will help people get to work and keep families safe while driving. [2/6]

1346936248913588228.text: This insurrection will not deter Congress from certifying the election — our democracy depends on it.

1346912146223886337.text: My staff and I are safe — we are now sheltering in place and will continue to follow law enforcement's guidance. Thank you to the Capitol Police for working to keep us all safe.

1346869854998048774.text: The American people voted for Joe Biden. Today Congress will fulfill our duty and certify this election.
